snippet: The emergence of a video this week in the Rice case raises questions about whether sports leagues should take more responsibility for domestic violence involving their athletes.
abstract: Emergence of video in case of former Baltimore Ravens running back Ray Rice raises questions about whether sports leagues should take more responsibility for domestic violence involving their athletes; steadfast stance that accused athlete should be allowed to play until convicted has made it commonplace for athletes to suit up for games while facing charges of domestic abuse.
lead_paragraph: The emergence of a video this week in the Rice case raises questions about whether sports leagues should take more responsibility for domestic violence involving their athletes.

headline.main: Ray Rice Is an Outlier: Most Domestic Abuse Suspects Play On
headline.print_headline: Ray Rice Is an Outlier: Most Suspects Play On
